segment.source: Manage app access to Exchange Online
segment.target: Manage app access to Exchange Online

segment.source: Manage app access to Exchange Online
segment.target: Manage app access to Exchange Online

segment.source: You can choose which apps should be allowed to access Exchange Online and the users who are affected by the policy.
segment.target: You can choose which apps should be allowed to access Exchange Online and the users who are affected by the policy.

segment.source: This topic gives you step by step instructions on how to set up app access to Exchange Online service.
segment.target: This topic gives you step by step instructions on how to set up app access to Exchange Online service.

segment.source: Create Exchange Online policy
segment.target: Create Exchange Online policy

segment.source: Sign into this Azure portal that includes the app access feature.
segment.target: Sign into this Azure portal that includes the app access feature.

segment.source: From Browse, click Intune.
segment.target: From Browse, click Intune.

segment.source: This opens the Intune mobile application management blade and the Settings blade.
segment.target: This opens the Intune mobile application management blade and the Settings blade.

segment.source: From the Settings blade, click Exchange Online to open the Exchange Online blade.
segment.target: From the Settings blade, click Exchange Online to open the Exchange Online blade.

segment.source: App_Access_EXO
segment.target: App_Access_EXO

segment.source: On the Allowed apps blade, first select whether you want to allow all apps, or only certain apps.
segment.target: On the Allowed apps blade, first select whether you want to allow all apps, or only certain apps.

segment.source: If you select to allow only certain apps to have access, you are presented with a list of apps that you can choose from.
segment.target: If you select to allow only certain apps to have access, you are presented with a list of apps that you can choose from.

segment.source: Select one or more apps from the list and save your changes.
segment.target: Select one or more apps from the list and save your changes.

segment.source: AppAccess_EXO_AllowedApps
segment.target: AppAccess_EXO_AllowedApps

segment.source: To apply these restrictions to users, open Restricted user groups blade, and click Add user group.
segment.target: To apply these restrictions to users, open Restricted user groups blade, and click Add user group.

segment.source: This open the Add user group blade that lists your Azure AD user groups.
segment.target: This open the Add user group blade that lists your Azure AD user groups.

segment.source: Select one or more groups, and click Select.
segment.target: Select one or more groups, and click Select.

segment.source: AppAccess_EXO_RestrictedUserGroup
segment.target: AppAccess_EXO_RestrictedUserGroup

segment.source: You may want some users in the user group you selected in the previous step not to be affected by this restriction.
segment.target: You may want some users in the user group you selected in the previous step not to be affected by this restriction.

segment.source: In such cases, add the group of users to the Exempted user groups list.
segment.target: In such cases, add the group of users to the Exempted user groups list.

segment.source: From the Exchange Online blade, click Exempted user groups.
segment.target: From the Exchange Online blade, click Exempted user groups.

segment.source: Click Add user group to open the list of user groups.
segment.target: Click Add user group to open the list of user groups.

segment.source: Select the groups you want to exempt from this restriction, and click Select to create the access policy for Exchange Online.
segment.target: Select the groups you want to exempt from this restriction, and click Select to create the access policy for Exchange Online.

segment.source: AppAccess_ExemptedUserGroup
segment.target: AppAccess_ExemptedUserGroup

segment.source: To delete a user group from the restricted user groups list, open the Restricted user groups blade, highlight the user group you want to delete, and click on the …
segment.target: To delete a user group from the restricted user groups list, open the Restricted user groups blade, highlight the user group you want to delete, and click on the …

segment.source: to see the delete option.
segment.target: to see the delete option.

segment.source: Click Delete to remove the user group from the list.
segment.target: Click Delete to remove the user group from the list.

segment.source: AppAccess_EXO_DeleteUserGroup
segment.target: AppAccess_EXO_DeleteUserGroup

segment.source: You can follow the same step to remove a user group from the Exempted user group list.
segment.target: You can follow the same step to remove a user group from the Exempted user group list.
